title: Must visit in Dehadun
review: Culture and religious must visit place in dehradun. Better to visit in morning due traffic and gets crowded, the approach road is very bad with lots of Jams.

title: Jai Bhole Baba
review: Very nice temple situated on the way to Mussoorie. Parking is an issue here. They offer very nice prashad. Also has shops adjacent to the temple.

title: Parking Problem
review: I visited Bhole Baba in this temple for the first time, so I did not know about the parking issue here. There is a lot of parking problem here and I want to alert you. The temple is quite beautiful and peaceful and it is worth visiting once. Blessed.

title: Spiritual
review: It is a spiritual place- specially famous as Shiv Mandir on the Mussoorie Road. One can visit the place on the way to or while coming back from Mussoorie. Temple has a very limited parking space but generally people leave their vehicle on the road side outside.

title: Good place, Beautiful temple
review: Shiv mandir was beautiful temple. I have took visit here in evening time. Nice place for visit with family. It's a peaceful place.

title: Place of worship
review: This is a place where one can get peace of mind and good place for worship.One should go to this place for worship whenever he/she gets a chance

title: Jai shiv shambhu
review: Divine is the only word which comes in mind after visiting Lord's temple. One can purchase real,guaranteed Rudraksh and other devotional items. Also the prasad is a must. Shiv ki pooja karo, sab milega..

title: Worth a visit
review: one of the few places which has signboard which says that don't donate any money. located on the ghat en route to mussorie, its on the way if you are headed up and you can definitely take a pit spot and visit the temple.

title: Nothing Important
review: This Shiv temple is constructed almost 30 years back on Dehradun- Mussoorie road. It’s nearby 10km from Dehradun city. How authorities gave permission to construct temple on main road ,is still question? But in the name of religion, all are afraid. Place was initially started with selling various artificial gems but later on , included as tourist destination in the name of Shiva temple.

title: One of the best one
review: This is one of the finest temples you would visit in and around the area

title: It is private Shiv Mandir
review: No Donation allowed. A must visit for everyone. Shiva Lings are pure and divine. Staff are not bother of devotee. Prasad served was holistic. This temple is along the way to Mussoorie, and the good place for the devotees of shiv, the temple offers a good view.

title: My recent visit here
review: We visited this temple while we were coming to Dehradun. The Temple location is nice, just adjacent to the main road. Car parking area is also available in front of the temple.

title: Om namah Shivay !
review: I visited the temple with family on my birthday. I visited this temple after a long time. This temple is the private temple and doesn't accept any kind of chadava Prasad and money. However they serve poori sabji , tea etc as prashad according to the days. I got the khir and tea as prashad..

title: A must stop.. on the road side
review: This is a mandir which is on the road and one doesnt have to walk. As you drive by, its nice to stop for a darshan...and move ahead with apeaceful mind

title: Ice cream on subsidy!
review: The temple is nice and peaceful. It's en route Mussoorie so its always crowded. Ant hey have subsidized ice cream which doubles up as prasad from the temple. What more do you want!

title: On the way to Mussoorie nothing exiting
review: The temple is situated on main Dehradun Mussoorie road about 12 km from clock tower the management there is actually interested in selling astrological stones gems nothing special or historical

title: Nice religious place
review: The temple has a great history and situated at a very beautiful place. It is good to go with family.

title: Can be visited on way to Mussorie
review: One can halt on way to get icecream or light snacks. Religious minded can visit Lord Shiva inside. Stone or Gem lovers can get some nice items, but these are expensive. Rudrash is another attraction.

title: Very religious
review: It is situated on the Dehradun Mussorie highway. Mandir is dedicated to Lord Shiva. They do not accept any kind offerings. Huge  variety of stones and rudrakhs are available for devotees.

title: A good place to visit if you love visiting Hindu temples
review: This temple is dedicated to Lord Shiva and is quite an old temple which is flocked by many from far and near. Me and my family have to visit this temple whenever we visit Dehradun. The word of caution- This place has lot of monkeys which flock around the temple for food...they may snatch your belongings if you are not too cautious. Avoid feeding them as they keep crossing the busy highway (which goes to Mussorie Hills), cause they are prone to get killed or injured by approaching vehicles. Overall a good place to visit. Om Namah Shivay !

title: Doon Shiv Mandir 2018
review: I visit the temple whenever I am in Dehra dun. A must visit temple for all Hindu and Shivaites visiting Doon valley.

title: Stopover on the way to mussorie
review: Its a temple on the way to mussorie managed privately.Donation is strictly prohibited.

title: Shiva temple in a scenic place
review: Beautiful shiva lingas and nice decoration. We can do Abhishek ourselves. Free Tasty Prasad and hot chai.

title: Divine and Spiritual place with awesome view of Dehradun
review: Shiva Temple is famous for its Chai and Prasad and also for no donation and 'Dhoop batti' formula which is quite good and impressive also there is vast variety of Ratna like Panna, Neelam and other precious stone. you can visit there for peaceof mind and also enjoy chill nature of musooriee foot hills.

title: Feeling religious
review: Har Har Mahadev. Always feel inner peace when I enter this place. Just feel like sitting at the temple stairs and let the calmness and positive energy seep in.

title: Spiritual place
review: While going and coming back from mussorie we stopped here.. Shiva temple, nice place with good break. You get free tea over here as prasad. Loved it

title: Great place
review: It's located in the dehradoon to mussoorie road. It's a must visit place while u are in mussoorie or dehradun. Place of great significance.

title: Om
review: On our way up to Mussoorie there is this temple which is called Shiv Temple on the right side of the road is a very popular place among religious persons. They visit this place and the best part is one does not have to give any 'Pranami. They will give you 'Prasad'.  A lot of people believe highly for this temple. For me it was neat and clean.'

title: Temple of solace
review: A must visit for everyone...Spathic Shiva Lingas are pure and divine..staff is very arrogant and loud...Prasad served was holistic..

title: Peace Haven
review: Good reminder for those who spend 1000s of Rs on God and don’t help the needy.

title: Awesome Place
review: This temple is along the way to Mussoorie, and the good place for the devotees of shiv, the temple offers a good view, and the shops there offer a good discount.

title: DIVINE
review: This temple is made on the curves of Mussoorie very beautifully made as its very colourful from outside as well as from Inside. When ever you get time to visit do visit it's open to all. As you get warm tea and Prasad to eat.

title: Shiv Mandir on way to Mussoorie
review: When you are going to Mussoorie this temple is almost half way to mussoorie. It is not historical temple but a good place to visit. Temple is nice. It has a very good and big Shivlingum made of Asfhatik stone. They serve you with hot tea and prasad made of rice/rajma, rice /kadi, kitchdi.

title: Temple
review: Popular among the tourists and locals both. It is situated on the main Dehradun Mussourie road. Good view from the parking of the valley.

title: Good temple, donation free!
review: One of the few temples that does NOT take money donations and it is clearly mentioned everywhere. The temple is on the way to Mussoorie and many pilgrims visit it on their way either up or down the hills.The view from the temple is good and gives a vantage point for the valley.  A lot of pilgrims wait for the prasad and also look at the jewellery/gems being sold.

title: Shiv temple mussoorie road
review: Shiv  Mandhir  is situated on main mussoorie road approx. 17 kms from Dehradun. It is a very good Shiva temple . In the temple premises there is a shop Shiv Ratan Kendra who claim to be selling original Rudrakh  and other gems. The items are good but a little bit costly. In the temple Prasad is being distributed and tea is offered. No money is offered to the deity.

title: Temple & tea
review: Nice place on the way to mussouri from dehradun. Tea is famous which is available inside temple. It opens at 8 am and close at 9 pm.

title: Shiva temple on mussoorie road
review: This temple is a private operated temple and is not by any trust. The donation is strictly prohibited here. There are lot of monkeys around the temple.

title: Har har mahadev!!!
review: Very good temple of Lord Shiva. We went in the evening and visited this temple. Less crowded one and divine feeling.

title: No donation plaese
review: The temple is on the Mussoorie road from Dehradun, You cannot miss this temple. There are no proper parking place other than the road. The best thing about this temple- usually no que & no rush. You can leave footwear just outside temple. Every where there are boards in Hindi & english - PLEASE DONOT PAY MONEY- No HUNDI to donoate. 2 types of prasad- Rice Pudding & Tea prasad ( No where in India )

title: On the way to Mussoorie
review: You can visit this place while going from Dehradun to Mussoorie. Parking is a problem here. It is also called Prakasheshwar Shiv temple. There are small shops where you can buy different types of gems.

title: Jai Bholenath
review: Shiv mandir is situated on the Mansoori Road.A spiritual place in dehradun with less crowed. But parking is a problem here.

title: way of mussoorie
review: if you are going dehradun to mussoorie you can visit here. it is a private property and the dont take money or donation. parking is a big problem but temple was very great.

title: Om Namah Shivay
review: On the way to mussoorie this temple shiv mandir is situated.  Its a private property and they don't accept any kind of donation or chadawa.  Lord shiva is in sphatik form.  You can buy gems from the in-house shop.  The prasad n tea which is offered to all devotees after darshan is very spritual.  Bum Bum Bhole.

title: A peace place
review: One of the few temples where no donations are accepted. Even anonymous donations are not allowed.

title: Temple of Lord Shiva
review: The temple is bang on the road of Doon - Mussoorie, only a frw minutes from edge of Rajpur up the way to the Mussoorie. Can't miss this. There's nothing particularly historical about this temple or the Lord Shivs here. Nice, clean and well maintained temple, although the cars around cause traffic slowdowns. Worth a quick stop.

title: Nice place for spending time
review: Its a famous shiv mandir located on the Mussoorie road. One must visit this place while going or returning to / from Mussoorie. Its a shiva temple and quite old. You will definitely find peace and calmness here.

title: Lord Shiva's Abode
review: This Shiv Mandir is unique in the sense that No Donations are allowed for offering. Situated on way to Mussorrie from Dehradun near Diversion, the temple is situated and one can have a pictorious view of mountains. As prasadam one gets free Tea, Kichari (Rice & Dal recepie) and puri-bhaji depending on time of arrival in the temple. One should stop enroute for a short break. Outside even icecreams are on sale at discounted price. Furthermore, gems and precious stones are also on sale. The atmosphere is peaceful and fragrant, however, beware of Monkey menance.

title: On the way to mussoorie....
review: Very nice temple....it is on the way to mussoorie......sfatic stone shiv ling is main attraction.  The shop of gem stones are very good....

title: Private Shiv temple on the way to Mussoorie
review: This temple at the beginning of the Ghag road to Mussoorie. The temple is private and cash offerings are strictly prohibited.

title: Good
review: A Temple of Lord Shiva in mussurie road. The unique thing is there, money donation not allowed. Very beautiful place, good to visit at least once.

title: Lord Shiva Temple
review: This temple is situated on mussorie road 15 kms from dehradun city. Nice and clean temple. It is a private temple and donation is strictly prohibited. You will get the prasad everyday and don't forget to have tea there it free of cost. You can also buy things from the shop inside the temple.  You will see sphatic shivling there. Must visit place.

title: Trek
review: I had my college on Mussoorie  Diversion Road  dit university  so in evening  to spend quality time with friends we use to trek till temple we usually feel calm , whole day stress just vanishes in seconds

title: Spiritual place
review: ll kinds of Gods are here. Specially famous for Shiv mandir. It's A huge temple and a wonderful spiritual place to spend the day. A place where kids can also enjoy in the running water. This lake is natural.

title: Perfect place for worship
review: We visit this temple on regular basis and this is perfect place for worship. Very clean. No offering to the God is one of the highlights of this temple. The trust take care of the entire expenses. Must Visit temple.
